bunpro.meaning: Even if, Even though, No matter how
bunpro.writeup: たってis a casual structure that carries the same meaning as 'ても' or 'でも', and can be used with a wide variety of words. Common translations include 'even if (A)', 'even though (A)', or 'no matter how (A)'.In the case of verbs,たってconjugates in the standard way that the た past-tense form usually would.For い-Adjectives,たってattaches to the conjugative く-form.For nouns and な-Adjectives, た will change to だ, and だって will then be used with the stem noun or adjective.Fun-fact - Althoughたってis widely considered a casual form of ても, it originally stems from たとて, which is a combination of theauxiliary verbた, and the particle とて, which itself is thought to be an old-fashioned abbreviation of と言っても. In this way, the modern abbreviation ofたってstill reflects the original extended nuance of たと言っても 'even if (A) is said, (B)'.

examples.japanese: 彼女に謝ったってどうせ許してくれないだろう。
examples.english: Even if I apologized to her, she wouldn't forgive me anyway.

examples.japanese: 先生に聞いたって、何も教えてくれないからインターネットで調べる。
examples.english: Even if I ask the teacher, they won't tell me anything, so I am going to look it up on the internet.

examples.japanese: どんなに欲しくたって、万引きをしてはいけない。
examples.english: No matter how much you want something, you must not shoplift.

examples.japanese: 稽古がどんなに楽しくなくたって、稽古中には欠伸をしてはならない。
examples.english: No matter how boring the lesson might be, you must not yawn during a lesson.

examples.japanese: こんな簡単な問題馬鹿だってわかるよ！
examples.english: Even an idiot can figure out a simple problem like this!

examples.japanese: 友達だって喧嘩をすることがある。
examples.english: Even friends can get into fights.

examples.japanese: 真剣に告白したって、彼女は冗談だと思うかもしれない。
examples.english: Even if I confess (my love) in all seriousness, she might think it is a joke.

examples.japanese: ブロッコリーが健康に良くたって、もう食べたくない！
examples.english: Even if broccoli is good for your health, I still don't want to eat it.

examples.japanese: どんなに押したくたって、この赤いボタンを押してはダメ。
examples.english: No matter how much you want to press it, you must not press the red button.

examples.japanese: まさか、また宿題忘れたの?あたしの友達だって、いちいち写させることができないわ。もっとしっかりしなさい！
examples.english: No way, you forgot the homework again?! Even if you are my friend, I can't let you copy it every single time! Get a grip!

examples.japanese: この試合に勝ったって、準々決勝には進めないよ。
examples.english: Even if I win the match I won't proceed to the quarterfinals!

false_friends.meaning: Even if ~ cannot or will not, Even though ~ not

Even if…is the case, Supposing that

Even if, No matter what, Whether or not, [Emphatic], Volitional+が

dojg.description: Even if someone did something or something were in some state (the desired result would not come about) or even if someone or something is in some state.

examples.japanese: (ksa).あの人には話したって分からない・分かりません。
examples.english: Even if I tell him that, he won't understand it.

examples.japanese: (ksb).僕はその切符を高くたって買う・買います。
examples.english: I will buy the ticket even if it is expensive.

examples.japanese: (a).お金があったって車は買いたくない。
examples.english: Even if I had money, I wouldn't want to buy a car.

examples.japanese: (b).本を買ったって、忙しくて読めない。
examples.english: Even if I buy books, I'm too busy to read them.
I don't care even if it is dirty.

examples.japanese: (d).遠くて不便だってマイ・ホームなら構いません。
examples.english: Even if it is far away and inconvenient, it doesn't matter if it is 'my home'.

examples.japanese: (e).どんなにいい先生だって時々間違います。
examples.english: No matter how good a teacher may be, he sometimes makes mistakes.

dojg.writeup: ## 1. たって is used strictly in informal spoken Japanese, and is used to indicate something counter to fact. However, the counterfactual (or subjunctive) nature of this construction is not very strong. See Example (a).
